intro: Pilosella novae-angliae, commonly known as the New England hairyleaf, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Pilosella novae-angliae is typically found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It is a perennial herb that is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardy nature.
